page.title: 09THE CHANGING LANDSCAPE
page.content: Mrs Rene Cook has lived in the Kingsley Green area for 22 years. She has seen some changes in her time. A General shop along the main road is now a restaurant. There used to be a Bakers and a Post Office. They have now been turned into private houses. There are two interesting sites in Bell Vale - Lowder Mill, the first of a chain of watermills, and Kingsley Green Pottery. There were houses called 'Bell Cottages' on the main road, which was a Dames School. There used to be a Public house called the 'Blue Bell'. There also used to be a Brewery at Bell Vale Lane. Bell Vale redeived its name from the Public house 'The Blue Bell'. The stream which runs along Bell Vale Lane rises on Blackdown near Cotchet Farm and is the main source of the river Wey.
